name: Void Raiders
description: Void Raiders is "radical" top down rogue-lite shmup, with permanent character progression, character centric gameplay and never ending carnage in randomly generated environments.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Processor: Intel i3-4160 3,6 GHz Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: Intel HD Graphics 4400 DirectX: Version 10 Storage: 200 MB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Processor: Intel i5-4460 Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 745 DirectX: Version 12 Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 200 MB available space

reviews.review_text: So far, I am in love with this game. I guess I'll do a pros and cons list for this one  PROS:  - graphics - sound effects - shooting is satisfying - lots of power ups that stack ( kinda like Risk of Rain, or more comparable to this, Dungeon Souls ) - replayability - all enemies are fair - it is SOMETIMES possible to play super aggressive which is always fun - plays more like an arcade game more than a roguelike, but I like it that way - level generation is 90% fair - Tryzna ( the developer ) has answered 2/3 of my questions, great developer!  CONS:  - the 10% of generation that ISN'T always fair: sometimes you spawn in and there's too many enemies to deal with at once ( minor complaint, but what can you expect from a random number generator ) - dodging isn't really possible outside of using cover, the character is too slow and the bullets are too fast  I give this game a SOLID 9/10 and look foward to spending lots of time with the game :)

all the visuals are giving me a headache... nothing even makes sense and i really feel there isn't enough to do, it's like a minigame.  thankfully it does have visuals, seems challenging enough and isn't that expencive. oh and also if you look beyond the constant headache you will have while playing i think the visualls are pretty damn amazing and the music are really good aswell. tho it just doesn't cut it for me...   in the end tho i really wouldn't recommand it, i think it should be free to play in order to prevent people having the go through the paying or asking their parents process. otherwise somewhere around 3Â£ or below would do
